headline: Bank of America promotes 387 employees to managing director, source says
summary: More than half of those promoted included women and people of color for the fifth consecutive year, the source said requesting anonymity, without providing the exact figure.  The cohort is bigger than last year's 334, with dealmakers at the biggest U.S. banks preparing for a year of revival in mergers and acquisitions activity as well as initial public offerings.  Banking sector executives are expecting a lighter regulatory touch under President-elect Donald Trump and lower interest rates to further spur dealmaking in the coming year.

headline: Bank of America inches after touting better-than-expected Q4 net interest income
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America inched higher on Wednesday after chief executive Brian Moynihan forecast better-than-expected net interest income and talked up the bank's deals pipeline.

headline: Bank of America Taps Adviser for Potential London Office Move
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Bank of America Corp. is preparing to explore options for a potential move out of its current London headquarters before the lease expires in 2032.
